definitions.definition: An unpleasant state of mental uneasiness, nervousness, apprehension and obsession or concern about some uncertain event.
An uneasy or distressing desire (for something).
A state of restlessness and agitation, often accompanied by a distressing sense of oppression or tightness in the stomach.
To confer knighthood; the conclusion of the ceremony was marked by a tap on the shoulder with a sword.
To name, to entitle, to call.
To deem.
To clothe or invest; to ornament; to adorn.
(heading) To strike, rub, or dress smooth; to dab.
To prepare (a gamecock) for fighting, by trimming the hackles and cutting off the comb and wattles.
A blow, thrust, or poke.
To make a noise by brisk drumbeats.
To do something badly.
In golf, to execute a shot poorly.
An unskillful, awkward person.
A mostly instrumental remix with all or part of the vocals removed.
A style of reggae music involving mixing of different audio tracks.
A trend in music starting in 2009, in which bass distortion is synced off timing to electronic dance music.
A piece of graffiti in metallic colour with a thick black outline.
The replacement of a voice part in a movie or cartoon, particularly with a translation; an instance of dubbing.
To add sound to film or change audio on film.
To make a copy from an original or master audio tape.
To replace the original soundtrack of a film with a synchronized translation
To mix audio tracks to produce a new sound; to remix.
A pool or puddle.
A twenty dollar sack of marijuana.
A wheel rim measuring 20 inches or more.
A lock.
A key, especially a master key; a lockpick.
To open or close.
Close observation of an individual or group; person or persons under suspicion.
Continuous monitoring of disease occurrence for example.
Systematic observation of places and people by visual, aural, electronic, photographic or other means.
In criminal law, an investigation process by which police gather evidence about crimes, or suspected crime, through continued observation of persons or places.
Easy to use, useful.
definitions.example: Some people regard duct tape as a handy fix-all.

definitions.definition: Nearby, within reach.
definitions.example: I keep a first-aid kit handy in case of emergency.

definitions.definition: Of a person: dexterous, skilful.
definitions.example: She's very handy: she made all her own kitchen cupboards.

definitions.definition: Physically violent; tending to use one's fists.
Of a freight ship: having a small cargo capacity (less than 40,000 DWT); belonging to the handysize class.
A hand job.
A handgun.
A state that is characterized by compulsive drug use or compulsive engagement in rewarding behavior, despite negative consequences.
The state of being addicted; devotion; inclination.
A habit or practice that damages, jeopardizes or shortens one's life but when ceased causes trauma.
A pathological relationship to mood altering experience that has life damaging consequences.
A soldier in a small independent group, fighting against the government or regular forces by surprise raids.
A non-official war carried out by small independent groups; a guerrilla war.
Relating to, using, or typical of guerrilla warfare, or its principles of small independent or non-official perpetrators.
Relating to, using, or typical of guerrilla marketing.
The organic process by which an organism assimilates food and uses it for growth and maintenance.
That which nourishes; nutriment.
The act of suspecting something or someone, especially of something wrong.
The condition of being suspected.
Uncertainty, doubt.
A trace, or slight indication.
definitions.example: a suspicion of a smile

definitions.definition: The imagining of something without evidence.
To suspect; to have suspicions.
To halt something temporarily.
definitions.example: The meeting was suspended for lunch.

definitions.definition: To hold in an undetermined or undecided state.
definitions.example: to suspend one's judgement or one's disbelief

definitions.definition: To discontinue or interrupt a function, task, position, or event.
definitions.example: to suspend a thread of execution in a computer program

definitions.definition: To hang freely; underhang.
definitions.example: to suspend a ball by a thread

definitions.definition: To bring a solid substance, usually in powder form, into suspension in a liquid.
To make to depend.
To debar, or cause to withdraw temporarily, from any privilege, from the execution of an office, from the enjoyment of income, etc.
definitions.example: to suspend a student from college; to suspend a member of a club

definitions.definition: To support in a liquid, as an insoluble powder, by stirring, to facilitate chemical action.
(travel) To remove the value of an unused coupon from an air ticket, typically so as to allow continuation of the next sectors' travel.
To eject; to expel.
To reveal (a person) as LGBT+ (gay, trans, etc).
To reveal (a person or organization) as having a certain secret, such as a being a secret agent or undercover detective.
To reveal (a secret).
definitions.example: A Brazilian company outed the new mobile phone design.

definitions.definition: To come or go out; to get out or away; to become public or apparent.
A pleasure trip or excursion.
An appearance to perform in public, for example in a drama, film, on a musical album, as a sports contestant etc.
The practice of publicly revealing that a person is homosexual or transgender without that person's consent.

A lash; a pliant, flexible instrument, such as a rod (commonly of cane or rattan) or a plaited or braided rope or thong (commonly of leather) used to create a sharp "crack" sound for directing or herding animals.
definitions.example: I had to use the whip to get the sheep's attention.

definitions.definition: A blow administered with a whip.
A whipper-in.
A member of a political party who is in charge of enforcing the party's policies in votes.
definitions.example: I was going to vote against the bill, but the party whip came to see me and made it clear I needed to vote for it.

definitions.definition: (UK politics, with definite article) A document distributed weekly to MPs by party whips informing them of upcoming votes in parliament.
Whipped cream.
definitions.example: Did you want to add some whip to your coffee, ma'am?

definitions.definition: A purchase in which one block is used to gain a 2:1 mechanical advantage.
A mode of personal motorized transportation; an automobile, all makes and models including motorcycles, excluding public transportation.
definitions.example: Come on, let's take my whip so we can get there in time.

definitions.definition: A move in which one player transfers momentum to another.
A whipping motion; a thrashing about.
definitions.example: I was startled by the whip of the rope when it finally snapped.

definitions.definition: The quality of being whiplike or flexible; suppleness, as of the shaft of a golf club.
Any of various pieces that operate with a quick vibratory motion
A coach driver; a coachman.
To hit with a whip.
definitions.example: The rider whipped the horse.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To hit with any flexible object.
definitions.example: I whipped her with a newspaper.

definitions.definition: To defeat, as in a contest or game.
To mix in a rapid aerating fashion, especially food.
definitions.example: to whip eggs or cream

definitions.definition: To urge into action or obedience.
definitions.example: He whipped the department into shape.

definitions.definition: To enforce a member voting in accordance with party policy.
To bind the end of a rope with twine or other small stuff to prevent its unlaying: fraying or unravelling.
To hoist or purchase by means of a whip.
To sew lightly; specifically, to form (a fabric) into gathers by loosely overcasting the rolled edge and drawing up the thread.
definitions.example: to whip a ruffle

definitions.definition: To throw or kick an object at a high velocity.
definitions.example: He whipped the ball at me.

definitions.definition: To fish a body of water especially by making repeated casts.
To snap back and forth like a whip.
definitions.example: The pennants whipped in the wind.

definitions.definition: To move very fast.
definitions.example: The wind whipped through the valley.

definitions.definition: To move (something) very fast; often with up, out, etc.
To transfer momentum from one skater to another.
To lash with sarcasm, abuse, etc.
To thrash; to beat out, as grain, by striking.
definitions.example: to whip wheat

definitions.definition: The process of adapting something or becoming adapted to a situation; adjustment, modification.
A change that is made or undergone to suit a condition or environment.
The process of change that an organism undergoes to be better suited to its environment.
An instance of an organism undergoing change, or the structure or behavior that is changed.
The process of adapting an artistic work from a different medium.
(authorship) An artistic work that has been adapted from a different medium.
The act of pursuing.
definitions.example: Unremitting pursuit of wealth doesn't bring happiness, particularly if successful.

definitions.definition: A hobby or recreational activity, done regularly.
A discipline in track cycling where two opposing teams start on opposite sides of the track and try to catch their opponents.
Prosecution
A member of a council.
In particular, a representative elected to a local authority, such as a city council: a city councillor
A male member of a monastic order who has devoted his life for religious service.
In earlier usage, an eremite or hermit devoted to solitude, as opposed to a cenobite, who lived communally.
A male who leads an isolated life; a loner, a hermit.
An unmarried man who does not have sexual relationships.
A judge.
A blotch or spot of ink on a printed page, caused by the ink not being properly distributed; distinguished from a friar, or white spot caused by a deficiency of ink.
A piece of tinder made of agaric, used in firing the powder hose or train of a mine.
A South American monkey (Pithecia monachus); also applied to other species, as Cebus xanthosternos.
The bullfinch, common bullfinch, European bullfinch, or Eurasian bullfinch (Pyrrhula pyrrhula).
The monkfish.
A fuse for firing mines.
To be a monk.
To act like a monk; especially to be contemplative.
To monkey or meddle; to behave in a manner that is not systematic.
To be intoxicated or confused.
To be attached in a way that sticks out.
A monkey.
A suggestion about a course of action.
A helmsman; a pilot.
To guide the course of a vessel, vehicle, aircraft etc. (by means of a device such as a rudder, paddle, or steering wheel).
definitions.example: I steered homeward.

definitions.definition: To guide the course of a vessel, vehicle, aircraft etc. (by means of a device such as a rudder, paddle, or steering wheel).
definitions.example: I find it very difficult to steer a skateboard.

definitions.definition: To be directed and governed; to take a direction, or course; to obey the helm.
definitions.example: The boat steers easily.

definitions.definition: To direct a group of animals.
To maneuver or manipulate a person or group into a place or course of action.
definitions.example: Hume believes that principles of association steer the imagination of artists.

definitions.definition: To direct a conversation.
To conduct oneself; to take or pursue a course of action.
The castrated male of cattle, especially one raised for beef production.
To castrate (a male calf).
A person from a country that is or was controlled by another.
A house that is built in a style reminiscent of the period of the colonization of New England.
Of or pertaining to a colony.
Of or pertaining to a period when a country or territory was a colony.
Of or relating to the original Thirteen Colonies of the USA.
Of or relating to the style of architecture prevalent at about the time of the Revolution.
The act of offering (an idea) for consideration.
An idea or a plan offered.
(business settings) The terms of a transaction offered.
In some states, a proposed statute or constitutional amendment to be voted on by the electorate.
(grammar) A complete sentence.

The content of an assertion that may be taken as being true or false and is considered abstractly without reference to the linguistic sentence that constitutes the assertion; (Aristotelian logic) a predicate of a subject that is denied or affirmed and connected by a copula.
definitions.example: “'Wiktionary is a good dictionary' is a proposition” is a proposition.

definitions.definition: An assertion so formulated that it can be considered true or false.
An assertion which is provably true, but not important enough to be called a theorem.
A statement of religious doctrine; an article of faith; creed.
definitions.example: the propositions of Wyclif and Huss

definitions.definition: The part of a poem in which the author states the subject or matter of it.
To make a suggestion of sexual intercourse to (someone with whom one is not sexually involved).
To make an offer or suggestion to (someone).
Any explosive substance.
With the capability to, or likely to, explode.

definitions.definition: Having the character of an explosion.
definitions.example: an explosive fire

definitions.definition: Shocking; startling.
definitions.example: an explosive accusation

definitions.definition: Easily driven to anger, usually with reference to a person.
definitions.example: He has an explosive personality.

definitions.definition: To move in regular procession through a system.
To change; transform.
To come into being; develop.
Of a population, to change genetic composition over successive generations through the process of evolution.
To give off (gas, such as oxygen or carbon dioxide during a reaction).
definitions.example: to evolve odours

definitions.definition: To cause something to change or transform.
A lack of clarity or order.
The state of being confused; misunderstanding.
A state of shame or embarrassment.
The trunk of a dead tree, cleared of branches.

definitions.definition: Any bulky piece as cut from the above, used as timber, fuel etc.
A unit of length equivalent to 16 feet, used for measuring timber, especially the trunk of a tree.
Anything shaped like a log; a cylinder.
A floating device, usually of wood, used in navigation to estimate the speed of a vessel through water.
A blockhead; a very stupid person.
A heavy longboard.
A rolled cake with filling.
A weight or block near the free end of a hoisting rope to prevent it from being drawn through the sheave.
A piece of feces.
A penis.
To cut trees into logs.
To cut down (trees).
To cut down trees in an area, harvesting and transporting the logs as wood.
A logbook, or journal of a vessel (or aircraft)'s progress
A chronological record of actions, performances, computer/network usage, etc.
Specifically, an append-only sequence of records written to file.
To make, to add an entry (or more) in a log or logbook.

definitions.definition: To travel (a distance) as shown in a logbook
To travel at a specified speed, as ascertained by chip log.
To move to and fro; to rock.
A Hebrew unit of liquid volume (about 1/3 liter).
Logarithm.
definitions.example: To multiply two numbers, add their logs.

definitions.definition: A difference of one in the logarithm, usually in base 10.
To count; to enumerate; to number; also, to compute; to calculate.
To count as in a number, rank, or series; to estimate by rank or quality; to place by estimation; to account; to esteem; to repute.
To charge, attribute, or adjudge to one, as having a certain quality or value.
To conclude, as by an enumeration and balancing of chances; hence, to think; to suppose; -- followed by an objective clause
definitions.example: I reckon he won't try that again.

definitions.definition: To reckon with something or somebody or not, i.e to reckon without something or somebody: to take into account, deal with, consider or not, i.e. to misjudge, ignore, not take into account, not deal with, not consider or fail to consider; e.g. reckon without one's host
To make an enumeration or computation; to engage in numbering or computing.
To come to an accounting; to draw up or settle accounts; to examine and strike the balance of debt and credit; to adjust relations of desert or penalty.
A public event where goods or property are sold to the highest bidder.
The first stage of a deal, in which players bid to determine the final contract.
To sell at an auction.
A twisting force.
Anything twisted, or the act of twisting.
The form given in twisting.
The degree of stress or strain when twisted.
A type of thread made from two filaments twisted together.
A sliver of lemon peel added to a cocktail, etc.
A sudden bend (or short series of bends) in a road, path, etc.
A distortion to the meaning of a word or passage.
An unexpected turn in a story, tale, etc.
(preceded by definite article) A type of dance characterised by rotating one’s hips. See Twist (dance) on Wikipedia for more details.
A rotation of the body when diving.
A sprain, especially to the ankle.
A twig.
A girl, a woman.
A roll of twisted dough, baked.
A small roll of tobacco.
A material for gun barrels, consisting of iron and steel twisted and welded together.

definitions.definition: The spiral course of the rifling of a gun barrel or a cannon.
A beverage made of brandy and gin.
A strong individual tendency or bent; inclination.

definitions.definition: An appetite for food.
To turn the ends of something, usually thread, rope etc., in opposite directions, often using force.
To join together by twining one part around another.
To contort; to writhe; to complicate; to crook spirally; to convolve.
To wreathe; to wind; to encircle; to unite by intertexture of parts.
To wind into; to insinuate.

definitions.definition: To turn a knob etc.
To distort or change the truth or meaning of words when repeating.
To form a twist (in any of the above noun meanings).
To injure (a body part) by bending it in the wrong direction.
(of a path) To wind; to follow a bendy or wavy course; to have many bends.
To cause to rotate.
To dance the twist (a type of dance characterised by twisting one's hips).
To coax.
In the game of blackjack (pontoon or twenty-one), to be dealt another card.
The state of being certain.
An instance of being certain.
A fact or truth unquestionably established.
Any serious injury to the body, often resulting from violence or an accident.
An emotional wound leading to psychological injury.
An event that causes great distress.
Someone who defends people or property
One of the players whose primary task is to prevent the opposition from scoring
A fighter who seeks to repel an attack
A lawyer who represents defendants, especially a public defender; a defense attorney (US) or defence counsel (UK)
A defendant in a civil action
A pointer or index that indicates something.
A meter or gauge.
The needle or dial on such a meter.
Any of many substances, such as litmus, used to indicate the concentration of a substance, or the degree of a reaction.
A plant or animal whose presence is indicative of some specific environment.
A measure, such as unemployment rate, which can be used to predict economic trends.
A turn signal; each of the flashing lights on each side of a vehicle which indicate a turn is being made to left or right, or a lane change etc.
A bird, the honeyguide.
A long-bladed weapon with a hilt, and usually a pommel and cross-guard, which is designed to stab, slash, and/or hack.
A suit in the minor arcana in tarot.
A card of this suit.
One of the end bars by which the lay of a hand loom is suspended.
The weapon, often used as a heraldic charge.
A socially, ethnically, or politically cohesive group of people.
A society larger than a band but smaller than a state.
A group of apes who live and work together.
A hierarchal rank between family and genus.
The collective noun for various animals.
(stock breeding) A family of animals descended from some particular female progenitor, through the female line.

definitions.definition: To distribute into tribes or classes; to categorize.
That which represents something else.
definitions.example: The Venus of Willendorf was an early representation of the female body.

definitions.definition: The act of representing.
definitions.example: We are no longer happy with your representation of our company at trade events.

definitions.definition: The lawyers and staff who argue on behalf of another in court.
definitions.example: People who cannot afford representation are eligible for government assistance.

definitions.definition: The ability to elect a representative to speak on one's behalf in government; the role of this representative in government.
definitions.example: The lack of representation in the British parliament was one of the main factors behind the American Revolution.

definitions.definition: An object that describes an abstract group in terms of linear transformations of vector spaces; (more formally) a homomorphism from a group on a vector space to the general linear group (group of all bijective linear transformations) on the space.
A figure, image or idea that substitutes reality.
A theatrical performance.
One who solicits.

In many common law jurisdictions, a type of lawyer whose traditional role is to offer legal services to clients apart from acting as their advocate in court. A solicitor instructs a barrister to act as an advocate for their client in court, although rights of audience for solicitors vary according to jurisdiction.
In English Canada and in parts of Australia, a type of lawyer who historically held the same role as above, but whose role has in modern times been merged with that of a barrister.
In parts of the U.S., the chief legal officer of a city, town or other jurisdiction.
A person soliciting sales, especially door to door.
A product or commodity from agriculture.
Of or pertaining to agriculture
definitions.example: An agricultural tool

definitions.definition: As if played with a scythe
One of the components of a compound leaf.
A small plant leaf.
definitions.example: The new leaflets at the end of the branch were a lighter shade of green than the mature leaves.

definitions.definition: A small sheet of paper containing information, used for dissemination of said information, often an advertisement.
definitions.example: A leaflet had been left under the car's windshield wiper.

definitions.definition: A flap of a valve of a heart or blood vessel.
To distribute leaflets to.
definitions.example: A sidewalk preacher gave an impassioned sermon while an assistant leafleted those who stayed to listen.

definitions.definition: To distribute leaflets.
definitions.example: During the summer, Peter earned some extra cash by leafleting for a local pizza delivery restaurant.

definitions.definition: A fatality; an event that leads to death.
A fatal error; a failure that causes a program to terminate.
Proceeding from, or appointed by, fate or destiny.
Foreboding death or great disaster.
Causing death or destruction.
definitions.example: a fatal wound; a fatal disease; that fatal day; a fatal mistake

definitions.definition: Causing a sudden end to the running of a program.
definitions.example: a fatal error; a fatal exception

definitions.definition: A short piece of music, often having improvisation, played on a solo instrument.
A volunteer.
A supporter of voluntarism; a voluntarist.
Done, given, or acting of one's own free will.
Done by design or intention; intentional.
definitions.example: If a man accidentally kills another by lopping a tree, it is not voluntary manslaughter.

definitions.definition: Working or done without payment.
Endowed with the power of willing.
Of or relating to voluntarism.
definitions.example: a voluntary church, in distinction from an established or state church

definitions.definition: Voluntarily.
A decision on an issue of fact in a civil or criminal case or an inquest.
definitions.example: The jury returned a “not guilty” verdict.

definitions.definition: An opinion or judgement.
definitions.example: a “not out” verdict from the umpire

definitions.definition: The condition of being prosperous, of having good fortune

An enclosed area, often outdoor, for the presentation of sporting events (sports arena) or other spectacular events; earthen area, often oval, specifically for rodeos (North America) or circular area for bullfights (especially Hispanic America).
definitions.example: A large crowd filled the seats of the arena.

definitions.definition: The building housing such an area; specifically, a very large, often round building, often topped with a dome, designated for indoor sporting or other major events, such as concerts.
definitions.example: The arena is grey with white beams.

definitions.definition: The sand-covered centre of an amphitheatre where contests were held in Ancient Rome.
definitions.example: The gladiators entered the arena.

definitions.definition: A realm in which events take place; an area of interest, study, behaviour, etc.
definitions.example: The company was a player in the maritime insurance arena.

definitions.definition: One who applies for something; one who makes a request; a petitioner.
definitions.example: Our job advertisement attracted seven applicants.

definitions.definition: The third coordinate (or z-coordinate) in a three-dimensional coordinate system.
The act of varying; a partial change in the form, position, state, or qualities of a thing.
A related but distinct thing.
definitions.example: All of his soups are variations on a single recipe.

definitions.definition: The angular difference at the vessel between the direction of true north and magnetic north.
A line of play that differs from the original.
A technique where material is repeated with alterations to the melody, harmony, rhythm, timbre, texture, counterpoint or orchestration; but with some invariant characteristic, e.g. a ground bass.
The modification of a hereditary trait.
Deviation from the mean orbit of a heavenly body.
The act of eating, drinking or using.
definitions.example: The consumption of snails as food is more common in France than in England.

definitions.definition: The amount consumed.
definitions.example: gross national consumption

definitions.definition: The act of consuming or destroying.
definitions.example: The fire's consumption of the forest caused ecological changes.

definitions.definition: The wasting away of the human body through disease.
Pulmonary tuberculosis and other diseases that cause wasting away, lung infection, etc.
(now usually in the plural) Sanity.
definitions.example: He's gone completely out of his wits.

definitions.definition: (obsolete usually in the plural) The senses.
Intellectual ability; faculty of thinking, reasoning.
definitions.example: Where she has gone to is beyond the wit of man to say.

definitions.definition: The ability to think quickly; mental cleverness, especially under short time constraints.
definitions.example: My father had a quick wit and a steady hand.

definitions.definition: Intelligence; common sense.
definitions.example: The opportunity was right in front of you, and you didn't even have the wit to take it!

definitions.definition: Humour, especially when clever or quick.
definitions.example: The best man's speech was hilarious, full of wit and charm.

definitions.definition: A person who tells funny anecdotes or jokes; someone witty.
definitions.example: Your friend is quite a wit, isn't he?

definitions.definition: Know, be aware of (constructed with of when used intransitively).
definitions.example: They are meddling in matters that men should not wit of.

definitions.definition: Against.
definitions.example: He picked a fight with the class bully.

definitions.definition: In the company of; alongside, close to; near to.
definitions.example: He went with his friends.

definitions.definition: In addition to; as an accessory to.
definitions.example: She owns a motorcycle with a sidecar.

definitions.definition: Used to indicate simultaneous happening, or immediate succession or consequence.
definitions.example: Jim was listening to Bach with his eyes closed.

definitions.definition: In support of.
definitions.example: We are with you all the way.

definitions.definition: In regard to.
definitions.example: He was pleased with the outcome.

definitions.definition: To denote the accomplishment of cause, means, instrument, etc; – sometimes equivalent to by.
definitions.example: slain with robbers

definitions.definition: Using as an instrument; by means of.
definitions.example: Find what you want instantly with our search engine.

definitions.definition: Using as nourishment; more recently replaced by on.
Having, owning.
definitions.example: It was small and bumpy, with a tinge of orange.

definitions.definition: Affected by (a certain emotion or condition).
definitions.example: He spoke with sadness in his voice.

definitions.definition: Prompted by (a certain emotion).
definitions.example: green with envy; flushed with success

definitions.definition: A brag; ostentatious positive appraisal of oneself.
Something that one brags about.
definitions.example: It was his regular boast that he could eat two full English breakfasts in one sitting.

definitions.definition: A shot where the ball is driven off a side wall and then strikes the front wall.
To brag; to talk loudly in praise of oneself.
To speak of with pride, vanity, or exultation, with a view to self-commendation; to extol.
To speak in exulting language of another; to glory; to exult.
To play a boast shot.
To possess something special.
definitions.example: His family boasted a famous name.

definitions.definition: To dress, as a stone, with a broad chisel.
(sculpting) To shape roughly as a preparation for the finer work to follow; to cut to the general form required.
An act of installing.
Something installed, especially the whole of a system of machines, apparatus, and accessories, when set up and arranged for practical working, as in electric lighting, transmission of power, etc.
A work of installation art.
A grouping of facilities that constitute a permanent military base.
A chance to speak; the right or power to influence or make a decision.
To pronounce.
definitions.example: Please say your name slowly and clearly.

definitions.definition: To recite.
definitions.example: Martha, will you say the Pledge of Allegiance?

definitions.definition: To tell, either verbally or in writing.
definitions.example: He said he would be here tomorrow.

definitions.definition: To indicate in a written form.
definitions.example: The sign says it’s 50 kilometres to Paris.

definitions.definition: To have a common expression; used in singular passive voice or plural active voice to indicate a rumor or well-known fact.
definitions.example: They say "when in Rome, do as the Romans do", which means "behave as those around you do."

definitions.definition: Suppose, assume; used to mark an example, supposition or hypothesis.
definitions.example: A holiday somewhere warm – Florida, say – would be nice.

definitions.definition: To speak; to express an opinion; to make answer; to reply.
(of a possession, especially money) To bet as a wager on an outcome; by extension, used to express belief in an outcome by the speaker.
For example; let us assume.
definitions.example: He was driving pretty fast, say, fifty miles per hour.

definitions.definition: Used to gain someone's attention before making an inquiry or suggestion
definitions.example: Say, what did you think about the movie?

definitions.definition: A type of fine cloth similar to serge.
Trial by sample; assay; specimen.
Tried quality; temper; proof.
Essay; trial; attempt.
To try; to assay.
A strainer for milk.
Characterized by or constituting (any kind of) irony.
Given to the use of irony; sarcastic.
Contrary or opposite to what may be expected.
definitions.example: It's ironic to have a blizzard in the middle of the summer.

definitions.definition: Odd or coincidental; strange.
definitions.example: It's ironic that we are eating a sandwich in Sandwich, Massachusetts.

definitions.definition: Exhibiting attributes, qualities, or acts that are worthy of or receive glory.
definitions.example: glorious deeds

definitions.definition: Excellent, wonderful
Bright or shining;
Eager for glory or distinction
Ecstatic; hilarious; elated with drink.
A person fulfilling a parental role.
definitions.example: Nowadays there are all kinds of potential parentals besides parents, grandparents, aunts and uncles, step-parents, in-laws, older siblings and cousins, and those in civil unions.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to a parent
Befitting a parent; affectionate; tender
Of the generation of organisms that produce a hybrid
A person who comments; especially someone who is paid to give his/her opinions in the media about current affairs, sports, etc.
A pigment (or dye)-based fluid used for writing, printing etc.
A particular type, color or container of this fluid.
The black or dark-colored fluid ejected by squid, octopus etc, as a protective strategy.
Publicity.
definitions.example: The TSA has been getting a lot of ink lately.

definitions.definition: Tattoo work.
Cheap red wine.
To apply ink to; to cover or smear with ink.
To sign (a contract or similar document).
To apply a tattoo to (someone).
(of a squid or octopus) to eject ink (sense 3)
An argument or disagreement, a failure to agree.
Verbal controversy or disagreement; altercation; debate.
To contend in argument; to argue against something maintained, upheld, or claimed, by another
To make a subject of disputation; to argue pro and con; to discuss
definitions.example: Some residents disputed the proposal, saying it was based more on emotion than fact.

definitions.definition: To oppose by argument or assertion; to controvert; to express dissent or opposition to; to call in question; to deny the truth or validity of
definitions.example: to dispute assertions or arguments

definitions.definition: To strive or contend about; to contest
To struggle against; to resist
Someone who or something which corresponds.
Someone who communicates with another person, or a publication, by writing.
A journalist who sends reports back to a newspaper or radio or television station from a distant or overseas location.
Corresponding; suitable; adapted; congruous.
(with to or with) Conforming; obedient.
To lead astray, in a false direction.
To deceive by telling lies or otherwise giving a false impression.
To deceptively trick into something wrong.
definitions.example: The preacher elaborated Satan's ways to mislead us into sin

definitions.definition: To accidentally or intentionally confuse.
A deception that misleads.
Deceptive or tending to mislead or create a false impression.
Hard to grasp; not obvious or easily understood; barely noticeable.
definitions.example: The difference is subtle, but you can hear it if you listen carefully.

definitions.definition: (of a thing) Cleverly contrived.
(of a person or animal) Cunning, skillful.
Insidious.
Tenuous; rarefied; of low density or thin consistency.
Refined; exquisite.
A peak; the topmost point or surface, as of a mountain.
definitions.example: In summer, it is possible to hike to the summit of Mount Shasta.

definitions.definition: A gathering or assembly of leaders.
definitions.example: They met for an international summit on environmental issues.

definitions.definition: (hiking) To reach the summit of a mountain.
Something
definitions.example: I need to get summit to eat.

definitions.definition: A place for storing large amounts of products. In logistics, a place where products go to from the manufacturer before going to the retailer.
To store in a warehouse or similar.
To confine (a person) to an institution for a long period.
To acquire and then shelve, simply to prevent competitors from acquiring it.
definitions.example: the warehousing of syndicated TV shows

definitions.definition: To determine which disease is causing a sick person's signs and symptoms; to find the diagnosis.
(by extension) To determine the cause of a problem.
The identification of the nature and cause of an illness.
definitions.example: He was given the wrong treatment due to an erroneous diagnosis.

definitions.definition: The identification of the nature and cause of something (of any nature).
A written description of a species or other taxon serving to distinguish that species from all others. Especially, a description written in Latin and published.
Treasure.
The blood-vessel in the yolk of an egg.
Race; lineage, pedigree.
Hereditary character, quality, or disposition.
definitions.example: There is a strain of madness in her family.

definitions.definition: A tendency or disposition.
Any sustained note or movement; a song; a distinct portion of an ode or other poem; also, the pervading note, or burden, of a song, poem, oration, book, etc.; theme; motive; manner; style
A particular breed or race of animal, microbe etc.
definitions.example: They say this year's flu virus is a particularly virulent strain.

definitions.definition: A portion of music divided off by a double bar; a complete musical period or sentence; a movement, or any rounded subdivision of a movement.
A kind or sort (of person etc.).
Language that is eloquent, poetic, or otherwise heightened.
The act of straining, or the state of being strained.
A violent effort; an excessive and hurtful exertion or tension, as of the muscles.
definitions.example: he jumped up with a strain;   the strain upon the sailboat's rigging

definitions.definition: An injury resulting from violent effort; a sprain.
A dimensionless measure of object deformation either referring to engineering strain or true strain.
The track of a deer.
To hold tightly, to clasp.
To apply a force or forces to by stretching out.
definitions.example: Relations between the United States and Guatemala traditionally have been close, although at times strained by human rights and civil/military issues.

definitions.definition: To damage by drawing, stretching, or the exertion of force.
definitions.example: The gale strained the timbers of the ship.

definitions.definition: To act upon, in any way, so as to cause change of form or volume, as when bending a beam.
To exert or struggle (to do something), especially to stretch (one's senses, faculties etc.) beyond what is normal or comfortable.
definitions.example: Sitting in back, I strained to hear the speaker.

definitions.definition: To stretch beyond its proper limit; to do violence to, in terms of intent or meaning.
definitions.example: to strain the law in order to convict an accused person

definitions.definition: To separate solid from liquid by passing through a strainer or colander
To percolate; to be filtered.
definitions.example: water straining through a sandy soil

definitions.definition: To make uneasy or unnatural; to produce with apparent effort; to force; to constrain.
To urge with importunity; to press.
definitions.example: to strain a petition or invitation

definitions.definition: Hug somebody; to hold somebody tightly.
To beget, generate (of light), engender, copulate (both of animals and humans), lie with, be born, come into the world.
definitions.example: A man straineth, liveth, then dieth.

definitions.definition: State of being disabled; deprivation or want of ability; absence of competent physical, intellectual, or moral power, means, fitness, and the like.
A mental condition causing a difficulty with an intellectual task.
definitions.example: Dyscalculia is math disability.

definitions.definition: Want of legal qualification to do a thing; legal incapacity or incompetency.
Regular payments received by a disabled person, usually from the state
definitions.example: Did you get your disability this month?

definitions.definition: A person who secretly watches and examines the actions of other individuals or organizations and gathers information on them (usually to gain an advantage).
To act as a spy.
definitions.example: During the Cold War, Russia and America would each spy on each other for recon.

definitions.definition: To spot; to catch sight of.
definitions.example: I think I can spy that hot guy coming over here.

definitions.definition: To search narrowly; to scrutinize.
To explore; to see; to view; inspect and examine secretly, as a country.
The act or process of acquiring.
definitions.example: The acquisition of sports equipment can be fun in itself.

definitions.definition: The thing acquired or gained; a gain.
definitions.example: That graphite tennis racquet is quite an acquisition.

definitions.definition: The process of sampling signals that measure real world physical conditions and converting these signals into digital numeric values that can be manipulated by a computer.
An act of tracing.
definitions.example: Your cell phone company can put a trace on your line.

definitions.definition: An enquiry sent out for a missing article, such as a letter or an express package.
A mark left as a sign of passage of a person or animal.
A residue of some substance or material.
definitions.example: There are traces of chocolate around your lips.

definitions.definition: A very small amount.
definitions.example: All of our chocolates may contain traces of nuts.

definitions.definition: A current-carrying conductive pathway on a printed circuit board.
An informal road or prominent path in an arid area.
One of two straps, chains, or ropes of a harness, extending from the collar or breastplate to a whippletree attached to a vehicle or thing to be drawn; a tug.

A connecting bar or rod, pivoted at each end to the end of another piece, for transmitting motion, especially from one plane to another; specifically, such a piece in an organ stop action to transmit motion from the trundle to the lever actuating the stop slider.
(fortification) The ground plan of a work or works.
The intersection of a plane of projection, or an original plane, with a coordinate plane.
The sum of the diagonal elements of a square matrix.
(grammar) An empty category occupying a position in the syntactic structure from which something has been moved, used to explain constructions such as wh-movement and the passive.
To follow the trail of.
To follow the history of.
To draw or sketch lightly or with care.
definitions.example: He carefully traced the outlines of the old building before him.

definitions.definition: To copy onto a sheet of paper superimposed over the original, by drawing over its lines.
To copy; to imitate.
To walk; to go; to travel.
To walk over; to pass through; to traverse.
To follow the execution of the program by making it to stop after every instruction, or by making it print a message after every step.
An insect of the order Hemiptera (the “true bugs”).
Any of various species of marine or freshwater crustaceans; e.g. a Morton Bay bug, mudbug.
Any insect, arachnid, or other terrestrial arthropod that is a pest.
definitions.example: These flies are a bother. I’ll get some bug spray and kill them.

definitions.definition: Any insect, arachnid, myriapod or entognath.
(chiefly computing and engineering jargon) A problem that needs fixing.
definitions.example: The software bug led the computer to calculate 2 plus 2 as 3.

definitions.definition: A contagious illness; a bacterium or virus causing it
definitions.example: He’s got the flu bug.

definitions.definition: An enthusiasm for something; an obsession
definitions.example: I caught the skiing bug while staying in the Alps.

definitions.definition: A keen enthusiast or hobbyist.
A concealed electronic eavesdropping or intercept device
definitions.example: We installed a bug in her telephone.

definitions.definition: A small and usually invisible file (traditionally a single-pixel image) on a World Wide Web page, primarily used to track users.
definitions.example: He suspected the image was a Web bug used for determining who was visiting the site.

definitions.definition: A small, usually transparent or translucent image placed in a corner of a television program to indicate what network or cable channel is televising it
definitions.example: Channel 4's bug distracted Jim from his favorite show.

definitions.definition: A manually positioned marker in flight instruments.
A semi-automated telegraph key.
Hobgoblin, scarecrow; anything that terrifies.
("the bug") HIV.
A limited form of wild card in some variants of poker.
A trilobite.
A young apprentice jockey.
To annoy.
definitions.example: Don’t bug me, I’m busy!

definitions.definition: To install an electronic listening device or devices in.
definitions.example: We need to know what’s going on. We’ll bug his house.

definitions.definition: A microfossil, particularly a foraminiferan.
The act of extending; a stretching out; enlargement in length or breadth; an increase
The state of being extended
That property of a body by which it occupies a portion of space (or time, e.g. "spatiotemporal extension")
A part of a building that has been extended from the original
Capacity of a concept or general term to include a greater or smaller number of objects; — correlative of intension.
A written engagement on the part of a creditor, allowing a debtor further time to pay a debt.
The operation of stretching a broken bone so as to bring the fragments into the same straight line.
An exercise in which an arm or leg is straightened against resistance.
A simple offensive action, consisting of extending the weapon arm forward.
A numerical code used to specify a specific telephone in a telecommunication network.
A file extension.
definitions.example: Files with the .txt extension usually contain text.

definitions.definition: An optional software component that adds functionality to an application.
definitions.example: a browser extension

definitions.definition: The set of tuples of values that, used as arguments, satisfy the predicate.
(grammar) A kind of derivative morpheme applied to verbs in Bantu languages.
That which limits the extent of anything; limit, extremity, bound, boundary.
definitions.example: "Alright, look...we can spend the holidays with your parents, but this time it will be on my terms."

definitions.definition: A chronological limitation or restriction.
definitions.example: The term of a lease agreement is the period of time during which the lease is effective, and may be fixed, periodic, or of indefinite duration.

definitions.definition: Any of the binding conditions or promises in a legal contract.
definitions.example: Be sure to read the terms and conditions before signing.

definitions.definition: A point, line, or superficies that limits.
definitions.example: A line is the term of a superficies, and a superficies is the term of a solid.

definitions.definition: A word or phrase, especially one from a specialised area of knowledge.
definitions.example: "Algorithm" is a term used in computer science.

definitions.definition: Relations among people.
definitions.example: We are on friendly terms with each other.

definitions.definition: Part of a year, especially one of the three parts of an academic year.
Duration of a set length; period in office of fixed length.
definitions.example: He was sentenced to a term of six years in prison.

definitions.definition: With respect to a pregnancy, the period during which birth usually happens (approximately 40 weeks from conception).
definitions.example: at term, preterm, postterm

definitions.definition: (of a patent) The maximum period during which the patent can be maintained into force.
A menstrual period.
Any value (variable or constant) or expression separated from another term by a space or an appropriate character, in an overall expression or table.
definitions.example: All the terms of this sum cancel out.

definitions.definition: The subject or the predicate of a proposition; one of the three component parts of a syllogism, each one of which is used twice.
An essential dignity in which unequal segments of every astrological sign have internal rulerships which affect the power and integrity of each planet in a natal chart.
A statue of the upper body, sometimes without the arms, ending in a pillar or pedestal.
A piece of carved work placed under each end of the taffrail.
definitions.example: The Cabin is large and commodious, well calculated for the Accommodation of Paſengers. Merchandiſe, Produce, &c. carried on the loweſt Terms.https//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/ea/Packet_Schooner.jpg

definitions.definition: To phrase a certain way; to name or call.
A computer program that emulates a physical terminal.
One whose employment has been terminated
To terminate one's employment
A person authorized to act as representative for another; a deputy
A representative at a conference, etc.
An appointed representative in some legislative bodies
A type of variable storing a reference to a method with a particular signature, analogous to a function pointer
To authorize someone to be a delegate
To commit a task to someone, especially a subordinate
(of a subdomain) to give away authority over a subdomain; to allow someone else to create sub-subdomains of a subdomain of one's own
A light, silvery metal extracted from bauxite, and a chemical element (symbol Al) with an atomic number of 13.
A single atom of this element.
Aircraft or other machinery made partially or wholly of aluminium.
An order or command.
definitions.example: I must obey the dictates of my conscience.

definitions.definition: To order, command, control.
To speak in order for someone to write down the words.
definitions.example: She is dictating a letter to a stenographer.

definitions.definition: A look; a glance.
To look with difficulty, or as if searching for something.
To come in sight; to appear.
Somebody who is, or something that is, at a level or of a value equal (to that of something else).
Someone who is approximately the same age (as someone else).
A noble with a hereditary title, i.e., a peerage, and in times past, with certain rights and privileges not enjoyed by commoners.
definitions.example: a peer of the realm

definitions.definition: A comrade; a companion; an associate.
To make equal in rank.

To carry communications traffic terminating on one's own network on an equivalency basis to and from another network, usually without charge or payment. Contrast with transit where one pays another network provider to carry one's traffic.
Someone who pees, someone who urinates.
A building in an airport where passengers transfer from ground transportation to the facilities that allow them to board airplanes.
A harbour facility where ferries embark and disembark passengers and load and unload vehicles.
A rail station where service begins and ends; the end of the line. For example: Grand Central Terminal in New York City.

A rate charged on all freight, regardless of distance, and supposed to cover the expenses of station service, as distinct from mileage rate, generally proportionate to the distance and intended to cover movement expenses.
A town lying at the end of a railroad, in which the terminal is located; more properly called a terminus.
A storage tank for bulk liquids (such as oil or chemicals) prior to further distribution.
The end of a line where signals are either transmitted or received, or a point along the length of a line where the signals are made available to apparatus.
An electric contact on a battery.
The apparatus to send and/or receive signals on a line, such as a telephone or network device.
A device for entering data into a computer or a communications system and/or displaying data received, especially a device equipped with a keyboard and some sort of textual display.
A computer program that emulates a physical terminal.
A terminal symbol in a formal grammar.
The end ramification (of an axon, etc.) or one of the extremities of a polypeptid.
To store bulk liquids (such as oil or chemicals) in storage tanks prior to further distribution.
Fatal; resulting in death.
definitions.example: terminal cancer

definitions.definition: Appearing at the end; top or apex of a physical object.
Occurring at the end of a word, sentence, or period of time, and serves to terminate it
Occurring every term; termly.
definitions.example: a student's terminal fees

definitions.definition: A sea or lake voyage, especially one taken for pleasure.
Portion of aircraft travel at a constant airspeed and altitude between ascent and descent phases.
A period spent in the Marine Corps.
To sail about, especially for pleasure.
To travel at constant speed for maximum operating efficiency.
To move about an area leisurely in the hope of discovering something, or looking for custom.
To inspect (forest land) for the purpose of estimating the quantity of lumber it will yield.
To actively seek a romantic partner or casual sexual partner by moving about a particular area; to troll.
(child development) To walk while holding on to an object (stage in development of ambulation, typically occurring at 10 months).
To win easily and convincingly.
definitions.example: Germany cruised to a World Cup victory over the short-handed Australians.

definitions.definition: A warden; a guard; a guardian or watchman.
Protection, defence.
A protected place, and by extension, a type of subdivision.
A person under guardianship.
An object used for guarding.
To keep in safety, to watch over, to guard.
To defend, to protect.
To fend off, to repel, to turn aside, as anything mischievous that approaches; -- usually followed by off.
To be vigilant; to keep guard.
To act on the defensive with a weapon.
A person, such as an ambassador, who is accredited to represent a government officially in its relations with other governments or international organisations
Someone who uses skill and tact in dealing with other people
The act of affecting or acting upon.

The state of being affected, especially: a change in, or alteration of, the emotional state of a person or other animal, caused by a subjective affect (a subjective feeling or emotion), which arises in response to a stimulus which may result from either thought or perception.
An attribute; a quality or property; a condition.
An emotion; a feeling or natural impulse acting upon and swaying the mind.
A feeling of love or strong attachment.
definitions.example: I have a lot of affection for my little sister.

definitions.definition: Disease; morbid symptom; malady.
To feel affection for.
A feeling of sympathy at the misfortune or suffering of someone or something.
definitions.example: I can't feel any pity towards the gang, who got injured while attempting to break into a flat.

definitions.definition: Something regrettable.
definitions.example: It's a pity you're feeling unwell because there's a party on tonight.

definitions.definition: Piety.
To feel pity for (someone or something).
definitions.example: You have got to pity the guy - he lost his wife, mother and job in the same month.

definitions.definition: To make (someone) feel pity; to provoke the sympathy or compassion of.
Short form of what a pity.
One who makes a donation.
definitions.example: The charity raised $2,000 from various donors.

definitions.definition: A group or molecule that donates either a radical, electrons or a moiety in a chemical reaction. Compare acceptor.
definitions.example: a carbonyl donor molecule

definitions.definition: A floor of a building below ground level.
A mass of igneous or metamorphic rock forming the foundation over which a platform of sedimentary rocks is laid.
Last place in a sports conference standings.
A second mowing; the grass which grows after the first crop of hay in the same season.
That which happens after, that which follows, usually of strongly negative connotation in most contexts, implying a preceding catastrophe.
definitions.example: In contrast to most projections of the aftermath of nuclear war, in this there is no rioting or looting.

definitions.definition: Deficiency in amount or quality; a falling short; lack.
A situation wherein, or amount whereby, spending exceeds government revenue.
A teenager.
Grief; sorrow; trouble.
Vexation; anger; hate.
The numbers between thirteen and nineteen.
definitions.example: The number of people at the meeting was in the teens.

definitions.definition: The time of life between thirteen and nineteen years old; the teenage years.
definitions.example: She is in her teens.

definitions.definition: The second decade of a century: the 1910s, 2010s, etc. The oneties, the tens.
(temperature, rates) The range between 10 and 19.
definitions.example: Although it was a scorching desert by day, temperatures could drop as low as the teens at night.

definitions.definition: To defeat in combat; to subjugate.
To acquire by force of arms, win in war.
definitions.example: In 1453, the Ottoman Empire conquered Istanbul.

definitions.definition: To overcome an abstract obstacle.
definitions.example: Today I conquered my fear of flying by finally boarding a plane.

definitions.definition: To gain, win, or obtain by effort.
definitions.example: to conquer freedom;   to conquer a peace

definitions.definition: The sharp cutting edge of a knife, chisel, or other tool, a razor blade/sword.
The flat functional end of a propeller, oar, hockey stick, screwdriver, skate, etc.
The narrow leaf of a grass or cereal.
The thin, flat part of a plant leaf, attached to a stem (petiole). The lamina.
A flat bone, especially the shoulder blade.
A cut of beef from near the shoulder blade (part of the chuck).
The part of the tongue just behind the tip, used to make laminal consonants.
A sword or knife.
A piece of prepared, sharp-edged stone, often flint, at least twice as long as it is wide; a long flake of ground-edge stone or knapped vitreous stone.
(ultimate frisbee) A throw characterized by a tight parabolic trajectory due to a steep lateral attitude.
The rudder, daggerboard, or centerboard of a vessel.
A bulldozer or surface-grading machine with mechanically adjustable blade that is nominally perpendicular to the forward motion of the vehicle.
A dashing young man.
A homosexual, usually male.
Thin plate, foil.
One of a series of small plates that make up the aperture or the shutter of a camera.
(in the plural) The principal rafters of a roof.
The four large shell plates on the sides, and the five large ones of the middle, of the carapace of the sea turtle, which yield the best tortoise shell.
Airfoil in windmills and windturbines.
A blade server.
An exterior product of vectors. (The product may have more than two factors. Also, a scalar counts as a 0-blade, a vector as a 1-blade; an exterior product of k vectors may be called a k-blade.)
The part of a key that is inserted into the lock.
To skate on rollerblades.
definitions.example: Want to go blading with me later in the park?

definitions.definition: To furnish with a blade.
To put forth or have a blade.
To stab with a blade
definitions.example: The gang member got bladed in a fight.

definitions.definition: To cut (a person) so as to provoke bleeding.
A kind of piton used in thin cracks.
Capable of producing something, especially in abundance; fertile.
Yielding good or useful results; constructive.
Of, or relating to the creation of goods or services.
(of an affix or word construction rule) Consistently applicable to any of an open set of words.
Of a cough, producing mucus or sputum from the respiratory tract.
Of inflammation, producing new tissue.
A type of set of natural numbers, related to mathematical logic.
definitions.example: a productive set

definitions.definition: Something that is marginal.
A constituency won with a small margin.
Of, relating to, or located at or near a margin or edge; also figurative usages of location and margin (edge).
definitions.example: In recent years there has been an increase in violence against marginal groups.

definitions.definition: Determined by a small margin; having a salient characteristic determined by a small margin.
Pertaining to changes resulting from a unit increase in production or consumption of a good.
A grinding apparatus for substances such as grains, seeds, etc.
definitions.example: Pepper has a stronger flavor when it is ground straight from a mill.

definitions.definition: The building housing such a grinding apparatus.
definitions.example: My grandfather worked in a mill.

definitions.definition: A machine used for expelling the juice, sap, etc., from vegetable tissues by pressure, or by pressure in combination with a grinding, or cutting process.
definitions.example: a cider mill; a cane mill

definitions.definition: A machine for grinding and polishing.
definitions.example: a lapidary mill

definitions.definition: The raised or ridged edge or surface made in milling anything, such as a coin or screw.
A manufacturing plant for paper, steel, textiles, etc.
definitions.example: a steel mill

definitions.definition: A building housing such a plant.
An establishment that handles a certain type of situation or procedure routinely, or produces large quantities of an item without much regard to quality, such as a divorce mill, a puppy mill, etc.
An institution awarding educational certificates not officially recognised
An engine.
A boxing match, fistfight.
(die sinking) A hardened steel roller with a design in relief, used for imprinting a reversed copy of the design in a softer metal, such as copper.
An excavation in rock, transverse to the workings, from which material for filling is obtained.
A passage underground through which ore is shot.
A milling cutter.
A treadmill.
A typewriter used to transcribe messages received.
To grind or otherwise process in a mill or other machine.
definitions.example: to mill flour

definitions.definition: To shape, polish, dress or finish using a machine.
To engrave one or more grooves or a pattern around the edge of (a cylindrical object such as a coin).
(followed by around, about, etc.) To move about in an aimless fashion.
definitions.example: I didn't have much to do, so I just milled around the town looking at the shops.

definitions.definition: To cause to mill, or circle around.
definitions.example: to mill cattle

definitions.definition: (of air-breathing creatures) To swim underwater.
(of a whale) To swim suddenly in a new direction.
To beat; to pound.
To pass through a fulling mill; to full, as cloth.
To roll (steel, etc.) into bars.
To make (drinking chocolate) frothy, as by churning.
To undergo hulling.
definitions.example: This maize mills well.

definitions.definition: To take part in a fistfight; to box.
To fill (a winze or interior incline) with broken ore, to be drawn out at the bottom.
(thieves' cant) To commit burglary.
An obsolete coin worth one thousandth of a US dollar, or one tenth of a cent.
One thousandth part, particularly in millage rates of property tax.
An angular mil, a unit of angular measurement equal to 1⁄6400 of a complete circle. At 1000 metres one mil subtends about one metre (0.98 m). Also 1⁄6000 and 1⁄6300 are used in other countries.
A unit of measurement equal to 1⁄1000 of an inch, usually used for thin objects, such as sheets of plastic.
A former subdivision (1/1000) of the Maltese lira
(plural "mil") Abbreviation of million.
A unit of measure of capacity, being one thousandth of a litre. Symbol: ml
A line of three matching pieces in nine men's morris and related games.
(trading card games) Discarding a card from one's deck.
(trading card games) A strategy centered on depleting the opponent's deck.
(trading card games) To move (a card) from a deck to the discard pile.
(Hearthstone) To destroy (a card) due to having a full hand.
A feeling of sadness or frustration when a strongly held expectation is not met.
A circumstance in which a strongly held expectation is not met.
That which causes feelings of disappointment.
definitions.example: Our trip to California was a disappointment.

definitions.definition: To encourage into action.
To arouse an organism to functional activity.
To grant as a possession; to bestow.
definitions.example: The college has conferred an honorary degree upon the visiting Prime Minister.

definitions.definition: To talk together, to consult, discuss; to deliberate.
definitions.example: They were in a huddle, conferring about something.

definitions.definition: To compare.
To bring together; to collect, gather.
To contribute; to conduce.
A piece of wood or other material, usually long and slender, pointed at one end so as to be easily driven into the ground as a marker or a support or stay.
definitions.example: We have surveyor's stakes at all four corners of this field, to mark exactly its borders.

definitions.definition: A piece of wood driven in the ground, placed in the middle of the court, that is used as the finishing point after scoring 12 hoops in croquet.
A stick inserted upright in a lop, eye, or mortise, at the side or end of a cart, flat car, flatbed trailer, or the like, to prevent goods from falling off.
(with definite article) The piece of timber to which a person condemned to death was affixed to be burned.
definitions.example: Thomas Cranmer was burnt at the stake.

definitions.definition: A share or interest in a business or a given situation.
definitions.example: The owners let the managers eventually earn a stake in the business.

definitions.definition: That which is laid down as a wager; that which is staked or hazarded; a pledge.

A small anvil usually furnished with a tang to enter a hole in a bench top, as used by tinsmiths, blacksmiths, etc., for light work, punching hole in or cutting a work piece, or for specific forming techniques etc.
A territorial division comprising all the Mormons (typically several thousand) in a geographical area.
To fasten, support, defend, or delineate with stakes.
definitions.example: to stake vines or plants

definitions.definition: To pierce or wound with a stake.
To put at risk upon success in competition, or upon a future contingency.
To provide another with money in order to engage in an activity as betting or a business venture.
definitions.example: His family staked him $10,000 to get his business started.

definitions.definition: The legal right to take care of something or somebody, especially children.
definitions.example: The court awarded custody to the child's father.

definitions.definition: Temporary possession or care of somebody else's property.
definitions.example: I couldn't pay the bill and now my passport is in custody of the hotel management.

definitions.definition: The state of being imprisoned or detained, usually pending a trial.
definitions.example: He was mistreated while in police custody.

definitions.definition: An area under the jurisdiction of a custos within the Order of Friars Minor.
definitions.example: The Custody of the Holy Land includes the monasteries of Bethlehem, Nazareth, and Jerusalem.

definitions.definition: The act of initiating hostilities or invasion.
The practice or habit of launching attacks.
Hostile or destructive behavior or actions.
The prevention, treatment, and management of illness or the preservation of mental and physical well-being through the services offered by the medical, nursing, and allied health professions.
definitions.example: I think free health care should also cover nearsightedness.

definitions.definition: Wages, money earned, income.
Business profits.
Gains on investments; returns.
Tending to ask questions, or to want to explore or investigate; inquisitive; (with a negative connotation) nosy, prying.
definitions.example: Young children are naturally curious about the world and everything in it.

definitions.definition: Caused by curiosity.
Leading one to ask questions about; somewhat odd, out of the ordinary, or unusual.
definitions.example: The platypus is a curious creature, with fur like a mammal and a beak like a bird.

definitions.definition: Careful, fastidious, particular; (specifically) demanding a high standard of excellence, difficult to satisfy.
Carefully or artfully constructed; made with great elegance or skill.
A device for moving or compressing a liquid or gas.
definitions.example: This pump can deliver 100 gallons of water per minute.

definitions.definition: An instance of the action of a pump; one stroke of a pump; any action similar to pumping
definitions.example: It takes thirty pumps to get 10 litres; he did 50 pumps of the weights.

definitions.definition: A device for dispensing liquid or gas to be sold, particularly fuel.
definitions.example: This pump is out of order, but you can gas up at the next one.

definitions.definition: A swelling of the muscles caused by increased blood flow following high intensity weightlifting.
A ride on a bicycle given to a passenger, usually on the handlebars or fender.
definitions.example: She gave the other girl a pump on her new bike.

definitions.definition: The heart.
(British slang) The vagina.
To use a pump to move (liquid or gas).
definitions.example: I've pumped over 1000 gallons of water in the last ten minutes.

definitions.definition: (often followed by up) To fill with air.
definitions.example: He pumped up the air-bed by hand, but used the service station air to pump up the tyres.

definitions.definition: To move rhythmically, as the motion of a pump.
definitions.example: I pumped my fist with joy when I won the race.

definitions.definition: To shake (a person's hand) vigorously.
To gain information from (a person) by persistent questioning.
To use a pump to move liquid or gas.
definitions.example: I've been pumping for over a minute but the water isn't coming through.

definitions.definition: To be going very well.
definitions.example: Last night's party was really pumping.

definitions.definition: To kick, throw or hit the ball far and high.
To pass gas; to fart.
To pass (messages) into a program so that it can obey them.
(British slang) To copulate.
To weightlift.
A type of shoe, a trainer or sneaker.
A type of women's shoe which leaves the instep uncovered and has a relatively high heel, especially a stiletto (with a very high and thin heel)
definitions.example: She was wearing a lovely new pair of pumps.

definitions.definition: A dancing shoe.
A type of shoe without a heel.
The unordered state of matter in classical accounts of cosmogony.
Any state of disorder; a confused or amorphous mixture or conglomeration.
definitions.example: After the earthquake, the local hospital was in chaos

definitions.definition: A behaviour of iterative non-linear systems in which arbitrarily small variations in initial conditions become magnified over time.
One of the two metaphysical forces of the world in some fantasy settings, as opposed to law.
A vast chasm or abyss.
A given medium; a space in which something exists or lives; an environment.
Loss or damage incurred through a disaster.
definitions.example: The war has taken its toll on the people.

definitions.definition: A fee paid for some liberty or privilege, particularly for the privilege of passing over a bridge or on a highway, or for that of vending goods in a fair, market, etc.
A fee for using any kind of material processing service.
definitions.example: We can handle on a toll basis your needs for spray drying, repackaging, crushing and grinding, and dry blending.

definitions.definition: A tollbooth.
definitions.example: We will be replacing some manned tolls with high-speed device readers.

definitions.definition: A liberty to buy and sell within the bounds of a manor.
A portion of grain taken by a miller as a compensation for grinding.
To impose a fee for the use of.
definitions.example: Once more it is proposed to toll the East River bridges.

definitions.definition: To levy a toll on (someone or something).
To take as a toll.
To pay a toll or tallage.
The act or sound of tolling
To ring (a bell) slowly and repeatedly.
definitions.example: Ask not for whom the bell tolls.

definitions.definition: To summon by ringing a bell.
definitions.example: The ringer tolled the workers back from the fields for vespers.

definitions.definition: To announce by tolling.
definitions.example: The bells tolled the King’s death.

definitions.definition: To draw; pull; tug; drag.
To tear in pieces.
To draw; entice; invite; allure.
definitions.example: Hou many virgins shal she tolle and drawe to þe Lord - "Life of Our Lady"

definitions.definition: To lure with bait; tole (especially, fish and animals).
To take away; to vacate; to annul.
To suspend.
definitions.example: The statute of limitations defense was tolled as a result of the defendant’s wrongful conduct.

definitions.definition: A bad habit.
definitions.example: Gluttony is a vice, not a virtue.

definitions.definition: Any of various crimes related (depending on jurisdiction) to prostitution, pornography, gambling, alcohol, or drugs.
A defect in the temper or behaviour of a horse, such as to make the animal dangerous, to injure its health, or to diminish its usefulness.
A mechanical screw apparatus used for clamping or holding (also spelled vise).
A tool for drawing lead into cames, or flat grooved rods, for casements.
A grip or grasp.
A winding or spiral staircase.
To hold or squeeze with a vice, or as if with a vice.
One who acts in place of a superior.
In place of; subordinate to; designating a person below another in rank
Instead of, in place of
definitions.example: A. B. was appointed postmaster vice C. D. resigned.
